tasks.title: Check weather forecast
tasks.description: Review local weather conditions and marine forecast

tasks.title: Inspect life jackets
tasks.description: Ensure all crew members have properly fitting life jackets

tasks.title: Check fuel level
tasks.description: Verify sufficient fuel for planned route

tasks.title: Test navigation lights
tasks.description: Ensure all navigation lights are functioning

tasks.title: Assess the situation
tasks.description: Determine the nature and severity of the emergency

tasks.title: Alert crew and passengers
tasks.description: Inform all persons on board of the emergency

tasks.title: Put on life jackets
tasks.description: Ensure everyone dons their life jackets immediately

tasks.title: Make distress call
tasks.description: Send MAYDAY on VHF Channel 16 if life-threatening

tasks.title: Deploy safety equipment
tasks.description: Prepare life raft, flares, and emergency beacon (EPIRB)

tasks.title: Attempt to control situation
tasks.description: Take immediate action to contain/resolve the emergency

tasks.title: Prepare for evacuation
tasks.description: If necessary, prepare to abandon ship

checklists.name: Arrival Procedures
checklists.description: Essential tasks to complete upon arrival at destination.

tasks.title: Secure the boat at the dock or anchorage
tasks.description: Properly moor the vessel with appropriate lines and fenders

tasks.title: Engine shutdown and post-operation checks
tasks.description: Turn off engine and perform post-operation inspection

tasks.title: Check all lines and fenders
tasks.description: Verify all mooring lines and fenders are properly secured and positioned

tasks.title: Log arrival time and location
tasks.description: Record arrival time, location, and relevant navigation notes

tasks.title: Check crew and passengers
tasks.description: Ensure all crew and passengers are safely disembarked or accounted for
